derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin castus

encyclopedia.content: 词义 形容词a. 纯洁的；正派的；高尚的；简朴的；淡泊的；简洁的，朴实无华的内涵 CHASTE通常用于形容人物道德品德高尚和纯洁，特别是对女性道德品德的一种赞许。同时，这种赞许，不需要外人来宣扬，完全是自身内心深处的纯洁和高尚。出淤泥而不染，如同荷花般美丽。美妆品牌 CHASTE，2010年该词组被启用为水木华年美容化妆品品牌名称，并向中国商标总局提交注册申请，2012年3月14日，已经成功注册公告。商标有效期限截至2022年3

entry.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as chaste, you mean that they do not have sex with anyone, or they only have sex with their husband or wife.

example.ex: Abramov did not live a chaste life.
example.tran: 阿布拉莫夫生活不检点。

entry.tran: 简洁的;朴实的;不重装饰的
entry.def: Something that is chaste is very simple in style, without very much decoration.

means.word_mean: 1. morally pure (especially not having experienced sexual intercourse);
2. pure and simple in design or style;

auth_sentence.content: Koolhaas deplored the chaste white-walled look of contemporary museums.
auth_sentence.res_content: Koolhaas deplored the chaste white-walled look of contemporary museums.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Koolhaas deplored the chaste white-walled look of contemporary museums.

auth_sentence.content: His garments, he later said, kept him chaste.
auth_sentence.res_content: His garments, he later said, kept him chaste.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His garments, he later said, kept him chaste.

auth_sentence.content: How shameless, he thought, and yet how chaste.
auth_sentence.res_content: How shameless, he thought, and yet how chaste.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How shameless, he thought, and yet how chaste.
